definition: quilt/by/(indicates passive-voice clauses)/(literary) to cover/to meet with/(coll.) (since c. 2009) used before a verb that does not accurately represent what actually happened, to describe with black humor how sb or sth was dealt with by the authorities (as in 被自殺|被自杀[bei4 zi4 sha1])
to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing

sentences.english: She was rejected by her father and his second wife. Zora was forced to take care of herself.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲和继母不养她，卓拉被迫自己照顾自己。

sentences.english: The enemy was advancing. The snow was stained with blood.
sentences.chinese: 首都被迫弃守，敌人步步进逼，鲜血将白雪浸染。

sentences.english: As it is I have been forced into becoming a sort of pamphleteer.
sentences.chinese: 事实是，我被迫成了一名写小册子的作家。

sentences.english: He is forced to ride in a second-class cabin because the train is unusually full.
sentences.chinese: 他被迫乘坐二等舱，因为火车是非常充分。

sentences.english: He was mugged from behind and forced into a dark room.
sentences.chinese: 他从背后被勒住脖子，被迫进入一间黑屋。

sentences.english: The town was forced to yield after a long siege.
sentences.chinese: 该城受长期围困而被迫弃守。

sentences.english: Children can't help fidgeting about if they're made to sit still for too long.
sentences.chinese: 儿童如果被迫久坐会情不自禁地把身体扭来扭去。

sentences.english: The workers were frequently beaten and were forced to live in prison-like conditions.
sentences.chinese: 工人们经常挨打挨饿，被迫在监牢般的环境中生活。

sentences.english: Chrysanthemum princess is forced to taking imperial jade seal, abscond everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 菊花公主被迫带着玉玺，四处逃亡。

sentences.english: After a series of losses, Braddock is forced into retirement.
sentences.chinese: 在一系列损失之后，布拉多克被迫退休。

sentences.english: He was forced to change tack.
He was invalided out of the army.
sentences.chinese: 他因伤病而被迫退役了。

sentences.english: Sewage systems continue to overflow, forcing many beaches to close.
sentences.chinese: 污水系统仍旧不堪重负，导致许多湖滩被迫关闭。

sentences.english: He was coerced into signing the contract.
The flight was forced to land in Russia due to mis-entry.
sentences.chinese: 航班因为误闯而被迫降俄罗斯。

sentences.english: Low water levels caused the country's largest hydropower dam to be shut down last month.
sentences.chinese: 上个月，低水位使得肯尼亚最大的水力大坝被迫关闭。

definition: to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
have no choice or option but to/cannot but/have to/can't help it/can't avoid
to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
constrained/restricted/forced to/under pressure to do sth
to do sth by force/Taiwan pr. [qiang3 xing2]
to fail to eventuate/(verb suffix) to be unsuccessful in ...ing
due to/as a result of/thanks to/owing to/since/because
